trans-unit.source: RMS Client Deployment Notes
trans-unit.target: RMS Client Deployment Notes

trans-unit.source: The Rights Management Service client (RMS client) version 2 is also known as the MSIPC client.
trans-unit.target: The Rights Management Service client (RMS client) version 2 is also known as the MSIPC client.

trans-unit.source: It is software for Windows computers that communicates with Microsoft Rights Management services on-premises or in the cloud to help protect access to and usage of information as it flows through applications and devices, within the boundaries of your organization, or outside those managed boundaries.
trans-unit.target: It is software for Windows computers that communicates with Microsoft Rights Management services on-premises or in the cloud to help protect access to and usage of information as it flows through applications and devices, within the boundaries of your organization, or outside those managed boundaries.

trans-unit.source: In addition to shipping with the <link><linkText>Rights Management sharing application for Windows</linkText><title></title></link>, the RMS client is available <link><linkText>as an optional download</linkText><title></title></link> that can, with acknowledgment and acceptance of its license agreement, be freely distributed with third-party software so that clients can protect and consume content that has been protected by Rights Management services.
trans-unit.target: In addition to shipping with the <link><linkText>Rights Management sharing application for Windows</linkText><title></title></link>, the RMS client is available <link><linkText>as an optional download</linkText><title></title></link> that can, with acknowledgment and acceptance of its license agreement, be freely distributed with third-party software so that clients can protect and consume content that has been protected by Rights Management services.

trans-unit.source: This topic includes the following sections:
trans-unit.target: This topic includes the following sections:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Redistributing the RMS Client</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Redistributing the RMS Client</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Installing the RMS Client</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Installing the RMS Client</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Questions and Answers About the RMS Client</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Questions and Answers About the RMS Client</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>RMS Client Settings</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>AD RMS Only: Limiting the RMS Client to Use Trusted AD RMS Servers</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>RMS Service Discovery</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Redistributing the RMS Client
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Redistributing the RMS Client

trans-unit.source: The RMS client can be freely redistributed and bundled with other applications and IT solutions.
trans-unit.target: The RMS client can be freely redistributed and bundled with other applications and IT solutions.

trans-unit.source: If you are an application developer or solution provider and want to redistribute the RMS client, you have two options:
trans-unit.target: If you are an application developer or solution provider and want to redistribute the RMS client, you have two options:

trans-unit.source: Recommended: Embed the RMS client installer in your application installation and run it in silent mode (the /quiet switch, detailed in the next section).
trans-unit.target: Recommended: Embed the RMS client installer in your application installation and run it in silent mode (the /quiet switch, detailed in the next section).

trans-unit.source: Make the RMS client a prerequisite for your application.
trans-unit.target: Make the RMS client a prerequisite for your application.

trans-unit.source: With this option, you might need to provide users with additional instructions for them to obtain, install, and update their computers with the client before they can use your application.
trans-unit.target: With this option, you might need to provide users with additional instructions for them to obtain, install, and update their computers with the client before they can use your application.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Installing the RMS Client
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Installing the RMS Client

trans-unit.source: The RMS client is contained in an installer executable file named setup_msipc_**.exe, where is either x86 (for 32-bit client computers) or x64 (for 64-bit client computers).
trans-unit.target: The RMS client is contained in an installer executable file named setup_msipc_**.exe, where is either x86 (for 32-bit client computers) or x64 (for 64-bit client computers).

trans-unit.source: The 64-bit (x64) installer package installs both a 32-bit runtime executable for compatibility with 32-bit applications that run on a 64-bit operating system installation, as well as a 64-bit runtime executable for supporting native 64-bit applications.
trans-unit.target: The 64-bit (x64) installer package installs both a 32-bit runtime executable for compatibility with 32-bit applications that run on a 64-bit operating system installation, as well as a 64-bit runtime executable for supporting native 64-bit applications.

trans-unit.source: The 32-bit (x86) installer will not run on a 64-bit Windows installation.
trans-unit.target: The 32-bit (x86) installer will not run on a 64-bit Windows installation.

trans-unit.source: You need elevated privileges to install the RMS client, such as a member of the Administrators group on the local computer.
trans-unit.target: You need elevated privileges to install the RMS client, such as a member of the Administrators group on the local computer.

trans-unit.source: You can install the RMS client by using either of the following installation methods:
trans-unit.target: You can install the RMS client by using either of the following installation methods:

trans-unit.source: Silent mode. By using the /quiet switch as part of the command-line options, you can silently install the RMS client on computers.
trans-unit.target: Silent mode. By using the /quiet switch as part of the command-line options, you can silently install the RMS client on computers.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a silent mode installation for the RMS client on a 64-bit client computer:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a silent mode installation for the RMS client on a 64-bit client computer:

trans-unit.source: Interactive mode. Alternately, you can install the RMS client by using the GUI-based setup program that's provided by the RMS Client Installation Wizard.
trans-unit.target: Interactive mode. Alternately, you can install the RMS client by using the GUI-based setup program that's provided by the RMS Client Installation Wizard.

trans-unit.source: To do this, double-click the RMS client installer package (setup_msipc_**.exe) in the folder to which it was copied or downloaded on your local computer.
trans-unit.target: To do this, double-click the RMS client installer package (setup_msipc_**.exe) in the folder to which it was copied or downloaded on your local computer.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Questions and Answers About the RMS Client
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Questions and Answers About the RMS Client

trans-unit.source: The following section contains frequently asked questions about the RMS client and the answers to them.
trans-unit.target: The following section contains frequently asked questions about the RMS client and the answers to them.

trans-unit.source: Which operating systems support the RMS client?
trans-unit.target: Which operating systems support the RMS client?

trans-unit.source: The RMS client is supported with the following operating systems:
trans-unit.target: The RMS client is supported with the following operating systems:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server Operating System
trans-unit.target: Windows Server Operating System

trans-unit.source: Windows Client Operating System
trans-unit.target: Windows Client Operating System

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: Windows 8
trans-unit.target: Windows 8

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

trans-unit.source: Windows 7 with minimum of SP1
trans-unit.target: Windows 7 with minimum of SP1

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008 (AD RMS only)
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008 (AD RMS only)

trans-unit.source: Windows Vista with minimum of SP2 (AD RMS only)
trans-unit.target: Windows Vista with minimum of SP2 (AD RMS only)

trans-unit.source: Which processors or platforms support the RMS client?
trans-unit.target: Which processors or platforms support the RMS client?

trans-unit.source: The RMS client is supported on x86 and x64 computing platforms.
trans-unit.target: The RMS client is supported on x86 and x64 computing platforms.

trans-unit.source: Where is the RMS client installed?
trans-unit.target: Where is the RMS client installed?

trans-unit.source: By default, the RMS client is installed in %ProgramFiles%\Active Directory Rights Management Services Client 2.<minor version number>.
trans-unit.target: By default, the RMS client is installed in %ProgramFiles%\Active Directory Rights Management Services Client 2.<minor version number>.

trans-unit.source: What files are associated with the RMS client software?
trans-unit.target: What files are associated with the RMS client software?

trans-unit.source: The following files are installed as part of the RMS client software:
trans-unit.target: The following files are installed as part of the RMS client software:

trans-unit.source: Msipc.dll
trans-unit.target: Msipc.dll

trans-unit.source: Ipcsecproc.dll
trans-unit.target: Ipcsecproc.dll

trans-unit.source: Ipcsecproc_ssp.dll
trans-unit.target: Ipcsecproc_ssp.dll

trans-unit.source: MSIPCEvents.man
trans-unit.target: MSIPCEvents.man

trans-unit.source: In addition to these files, the RMS client also installs multilingual user interface (MUI) support files in 44 languages.
trans-unit.target: In addition to these files, the RMS client also installs multilingual user interface (MUI) support files in 44 languages.

trans-unit.source: To verify the languages supported, run the RMS client installation and when the installation is complete, review the contents of the multilingual support folders under the default path.
trans-unit.target: To verify the languages supported, run the RMS client installation and when the installation is complete, review the contents of the multilingual support folders under the default path.

trans-unit.source: Is the RMS client included by default when I install a supported operating system?
trans-unit.target: Is the RMS client included by default when I install a supported operating system?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: This version of the RMS client ships as an optional download that can be installed separately on computers running supported versions of the Microsoft Windows operating system.
trans-unit.target: This version of the RMS client ships as an optional download that can be installed separately on computers running supported versions of the Microsoft Windows operating system.

trans-unit.source: Is the RMS client automatically updated by Microsoft Update?
trans-unit.target: Is the RMS client automatically updated by Microsoft Update?

trans-unit.source: If you installed this RMS client by using the silent installation option, the RMS client inherits your current Microsoft Update settings.
trans-unit.target: If you installed this RMS client by using the silent installation option, the RMS client inherits your current Microsoft Update settings.

trans-unit.source: If you installed the RMS client by using the GUI-based setup program, the RMS client installation wizard prompts you to enable Microsoft Update.
trans-unit.target: If you installed the RMS client by using the GUI-based setup program, the RMS client installation wizard prompts you to enable Microsoft Update.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>RMS Client Settings
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>RMS Client Settings

trans-unit.source: The following section contains settings information about the RMS client.
trans-unit.target: The following section contains settings information about the RMS client.

trans-unit.source: This information might be helpful if you have problems with applications or services that use the RMS client.
trans-unit.target: This information might be helpful if you have problems with applications or services that use the RMS client.

trans-unit.source: Some settings depend on whether the RMS-enlightened application runs as a client mode application (such as Microsoft Word and Outlook, or the RMS sharing application), or server mode application (such as SharePoint and Exchange).
trans-unit.target: Some settings depend on whether the RMS-enlightened application runs as a client mode application (such as Microsoft Word and Outlook, or the RMS sharing application), or server mode application (such as SharePoint and Exchange).

trans-unit.source: In the following tables, these settings are identified as Client Mode and Server Mode, respectively.
trans-unit.target: In the following tables, these settings are identified as Client Mode and Server Mode, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Where the RMS Client Stores Licenses on Client Computers
trans-unit.target: Where the RMS Client Stores Licenses on Client Computers

trans-unit.source: The RMS client stores licenses on the local disk and also caches some information in the Windows registry.
trans-unit.target: The RMS client stores licenses on the local disk and also caches some information in the Windows registry.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Client Mode Paths
trans-unit.target: Client Mode Paths

trans-unit.source: Server Mode Paths
trans-unit.target: Server Mode Paths

trans-unit.source: License store location
trans-unit.target: License store location

trans-unit.source: %localappdata%\Microsoft\MSIPC
trans-unit.target: %localappdata%\Microsoft\MSIPC

trans-unit.source: %allusersprofile%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\\
trans-unit.target: %allusersprofile%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\\

trans-unit.source: Template store location
trans-unit.target: Template store location

trans-unit.source: %localappdata%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Templates
trans-unit.target: %localappdata%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Templates

trans-unit.source: %allusersprofile%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\Templates\\
trans-unit.target: %allusersprofile%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\Templates\\

trans-unit.source: |Registry location|HKEY_CURRENT_USER \Software \Classes \Local Settings \Software \Microsoft \MSIPC|HKEY_CURRENT_USER \Software \Microsoft \MSIPC \Server \|
trans-unit.target: |Registry location|HKEY_CURRENT_USER \Software \Classes \Local Settings \Software \Microsoft \MSIPC|HKEY_CURRENT_USER \Software \Microsoft \MSIPC \Server \|

trans-unit.source: is the secure identifier (SID) for the account under which the server application is running.
trans-unit.target: is the secure identifier (SID) for the account under which the server application is running.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the application is running under the built-in Network Service account, replace with the value of the well-known SID for that account (S-1-5-20).
trans-unit.target: For example, if the application is running under the built-in Network Service account, replace with the value of the well-known SID for that account (S-1-5-20).

trans-unit.source: Windows Registry Settings for the RMS Client
trans-unit.target: Windows Registry Settings for the RMS Client

trans-unit.source: You can use Windows registry keys to set or modify some RMS client configurations.
trans-unit.target: You can use Windows registry keys to set or modify some RMS client configurations.

trans-unit.source: For example, as an administrator for RMS-enlightened applications that communicate with AD RMS servers, you might want to update the enterprise service location (override the AD RMS server that is currently selected for publishing) depending on the client computer's current location within your Active Directory topology.
trans-unit.target: For example, as an administrator for RMS-enlightened applications that communicate with AD RMS servers, you might want to update the enterprise service location (override the AD RMS server that is currently selected for publishing) depending on the client computer's current location within your Active Directory topology.

trans-unit.source: Or, you might want to enable RMS tracing at the client computer, to help troubleshoot a problem with an RMS-enlightened application.
trans-unit.target: Or, you might want to enable RMS tracing at the client computer, to help troubleshoot a problem with an RMS-enlightened application.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to identify the registry settings that you can change for the RMS client.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to identify the registry settings that you can change for the RMS client.

trans-unit.source: Task
trans-unit.target: Task

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: AD RMS only: To update the enterprise service location for a client computer
trans-unit.target: AD RMS only: To update the enterprise service location for a client computer

trans-unit.source: Update the following registry keys:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\ServiceLocation\EnterpriseCertificationREG_SZ: defaultValue::// RMS_Cluster_Name/_wmcs/CertificationHKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\ServiceLocation\EnterprisePublishingREG_SZ: defaultValue: :// RMS_Cluster_Name/_wmcs/Licensing
trans-unit.target: Update the following registry keys:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\ServiceLocation\EnterpriseCertificationREG_SZ: defaultValue::// RMS_Cluster_Name/_wmcs/CertificationHKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\ServiceLocation\EnterprisePublishingREG_SZ: defaultValue: :// RMS_Cluster_Name/_wmcs/Licensing

trans-unit.source: To enable and disable tracing
trans-unit.target: To enable and disable tracing

trans-unit.source: Update the following registry key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: TraceValue: 1 to enable tracing, 0 to disable tracing (default)
trans-unit.target: Update the following registry key:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: TraceValue: 1 to enable tracing, 0 to disable tracing (default)

trans-unit.source: To change the frequency in days to refresh templates
trans-unit.target: To change the frequency in days to refresh templates

trans-unit.source: The following registry values specify how often templates will be refreshed on the user’s computer if the TemplateUpdateFrequencyInSeconds value is not set.
trans-unit.target: The following registry values specify how often templates will be refreshed on the user’s computer if the TemplateUpdateFrequencyInSeconds value is not set.

trans-unit.source: If neither of these values are set, the default refresh interval for applications using the RMS client (version 1.0.1784.0) to download templates is 1 day.
trans-unit.target: If neither of these values are set, the default refresh interval for applications using the RMS client (version 1.0.1784.0) to download templates is 1 day.

trans-unit.source: Versions prior to this have a default value of every 7 days.Client Mode:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyValue: An integer value that specifies the number of days (minimum of 1) between downloads.Server Mode:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\REG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyValue: An integer value that specifies the number of days (minimum of 1) between downloads.
trans-unit.target: Versions prior to this have a default value of every 7 days.Client Mode:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyValue: An integer value that specifies the number of days (minimum of 1) between downloads.Server Mode:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\REG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyValue: An integer value that specifies the number of days (minimum of 1) between downloads.

trans-unit.source: To change the frequency in seconds to refresh templates<html></html><html></html>Important: If this is specified, the value to refresh templates in days is ignored.
trans-unit.target: To change the frequency in seconds to refresh templates<html></html><html></html>Important: If this is specified, the value to refresh templates in days is ignored.

trans-unit.source: Specify one or the other, not both.
trans-unit.target: Specify one or the other, not both.

trans-unit.source: The following registry values specify how often templates will be refreshed on the user’s computer.
trans-unit.target: The following registry values specify how often templates will be refreshed on the user’s computer.

trans-unit.source: If this value or the value to change the frequency in days (TemplateUpdateFrequency) is not set, the default refresh interval for applications using the RMS client (version 1.0.1784.0) to download templates is 1 day.
trans-unit.target: If this value or the value to change the frequency in days (TemplateUpdateFrequency) is not set, the default refresh interval for applications using the RMS client (version 1.0.1784.0) to download templates is 1 day.

trans-unit.source: Versions prior to this have a default value of every 7 days.Client Mode:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyInSecondsValue: An integer value that specifies the number of seconds (minimum of 1) between downloads.Server Mode:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\REG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyInSecondsValue: An integer value that specifies the number of seconds (minimum of 1) between downloads.
trans-unit.target: Versions prior to this have a default value of every 7 days.Client Mode:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyInSecondsValue: An integer value that specifies the number of seconds (minimum of 1) between downloads.Server Mode:HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\REG_DWORD: TemplateUpdateFrequencyInSecondsValue: An integer value that specifies the number of seconds (minimum of 1) between downloads.

trans-unit.source: AD RMS only: To download templates immediately at the next publishing request
trans-unit.target: AD RMS only: To download templates immediately at the next publishing request

trans-unit.source: During testing and evaluations, you might want the RMS client to download templates as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: During testing and evaluations, you might want the RMS client to download templates as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: To do this, remove the following registry key and the RMS client will download templates immediately at the next publishing request rather than wait for the time specified by the TemplateUpdateFrequency registry setting:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\\TemplateNote: could have both external (corprights.contoso.com) and internal (corprights) URLs and therefore two different entries.
trans-unit.target: To do this, remove the following registry key and the RMS client will download templates immediately at the next publishing request rather than wait for the time specified by the TemplateUpdateFrequency registry setting:HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\\TemplateNote: could have both external (corprights.contoso.com) and internal (corprights) URLs and therefore two different entries.

trans-unit.source: AD RMS only: To enable support for federated authentication
trans-unit.target: AD RMS only: To enable support for federated authentication

trans-unit.source: If the RMS client computer connects to an AD RMS cluster by using a federated trust, you must configure the federation home realm.HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\FederationREG_SZ: FederationHomeRealmValue: The value of this registry entry is the uniform resource identifier (URI) for the federation service (for example, "https://fs-01.contoso.com").
trans-unit.target: If the RMS client computer connects to an AD RMS cluster by using a federated trust, you must configure the federation home realm.HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\FederationREG_SZ: FederationHomeRealmValue: The value of this registry entry is the uniform resource identifier (URI) for the federation service (for example, "https://fs-01.contoso.com").

trans-unit.source: AD RMS only: To support partner federation servers that require forms-based authentication for user input
trans-unit.target: AD RMS only: To support partner federation servers that require forms-based authentication for user input

trans-unit.source: By default, the RMS client operates in silent mode and user input is not required.
trans-unit.target: By default, the RMS client operates in silent mode and user input is not required.

trans-unit.source: Partner federation servers, however, might be configured to require user input such as by way of forms-based authentication.
trans-unit.target: Partner federation servers, however, might be configured to require user input such as by way of forms-based authentication.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you must configure the RMS client ignore silent mode so that the federated authentication form appears in a browser window and the user is promoted for authentication.HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\FederationREG_DWORD: EnableBrowserNote: If the federation server is configured to use forms-based authentication, this key is required.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you must configure the RMS client ignore silent mode so that the federated authentication form appears in a browser window and the user is promoted for authentication.HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\FederationREG_DWORD: EnableBrowserNote: If the federation server is configured to use forms-based authentication, this key is required.

trans-unit.source: If the federation server is configured to use Windows integrated authentication, this key is not required.
trans-unit.target: If the federation server is configured to use Windows integrated authentication, this key is not required.

trans-unit.source: AD RMS only: To block ILS service consumption
trans-unit.target: AD RMS only: To block ILS service consumption

trans-unit.source: By default, the RMS client enables consuming content protected by the ILS service but you can configure the client to block this service by setting the following registry key.
trans-unit.target: By default, the RMS client enables consuming content protected by the ILS service but you can configure the client to block this service by setting the following registry key.

trans-unit.source: If this registry key is set to block the ILS service, any attempts to open and consume content protected by the ILS service will return the following error:HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_ACCESS_DISABLED_BY_POLICY)HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: DisablePassportCertificationValue: 1 to block ILS consumption, 0 to allow ILS consumption (default)
trans-unit.target: If this registry key is set to block the ILS service, any attempts to open and consume content protected by the ILS service will return the following error:HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_ACCESS_DISABLED_BY_POLICY)HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\MSIPCREG_DWORD: DisablePassportCertificationValue: 1 to block ILS consumption, 0 to allow ILS consumption (default)

trans-unit.source: Managing Template Distribution for the RMS Client
trans-unit.target: Managing Template Distribution for the RMS Client

trans-unit.source: Templates make it easy for users and administrators to quickly apply Rights Management protection and the RMS client automatically downloads templates from its RMS servers or service If you put the templates in the following folder location, the RMS client will not download any templates from its default location and instead, download the templates that you have put in this folder.
trans-unit.target: Templates make it easy for users and administrators to quickly apply Rights Management protection and the RMS client automatically downloads templates from its RMS servers or service If you put the templates in the following folder location, the RMS client will not download any templates from its default location and instead, download the templates that you have put in this folder.

trans-unit.source: The RMS client might continue to download templates from other available RMS servers.
trans-unit.target: The RMS client might continue to download templates from other available RMS servers.

trans-unit.source: Client Mode: %localappdata%\Microsoft\MSIPC\UnmanagedTemplates
trans-unit.target: Client Mode: %localappdata%\Microsoft\MSIPC\UnmanagedTemplates

trans-unit.source: Server Mode: %allusersprofile%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\UnmanagedTemplates\
trans-unit.target: Server Mode: %allusersprofile%\Microsoft\MSIPC\Server\UnmanagedTemplates\

trans-unit.source: When you use this folder, there is no special naming convention required except that the templates should be issued by the RMS server or service and they must have the .xml file name extension.
trans-unit.target: When you use this folder, there is no special naming convention required except that the templates should be issued by the RMS server or service and they must have the .xml file name extension.

trans-unit.source: For example, Contoso-Confidential.xml or Contoso-ReadOnly.xml are valid names.
trans-unit.target: For example, Contoso-Confidential.xml or Contoso-ReadOnly.xml are valid names.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>AD RMS Only: Limiting the RMS Client to Use Trusted AD RMS Servers
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>AD RMS Only: Limiting the RMS Client to Use Trusted AD RMS Servers

trans-unit.source: The RMS client can be limited to using only specific trusted AD RMS servers by making the following changes to the Windows registry on local computers.
trans-unit.target: The RMS client can be limited to using only specific trusted AD RMS servers by making the following changes to the Windows registry on local computers.

trans-unit.source: To enable limiting RMS client to use only trusted AD RMS servers
trans-unit.target: To enable limiting RMS client to use only trusted AD RMS servers

trans-unit.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\TrustedServers\
trans-unit.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\TrustedServers\

trans-unit.source: REG_DWORD: AllowTrustedServersOnly
trans-unit.target: REG_DWORD: AllowTrustedServersOnly

trans-unit.source: Value: If a non-zero value is specified, the RMS client will trust only the specified servers that are configured in the TrustedServers list and the Azure Rights Management service.
trans-unit.target: Value: If a non-zero value is specified, the RMS client will trust only the specified servers that are configured in the TrustedServers list and the Azure Rights Management service.

trans-unit.source: To add members to the list of trusted AD RMS servers
trans-unit.target: To add members to the list of trusted AD RMS servers

trans-unit.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\TrustedServers\
trans-unit.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\MSIPC\TrustedServers\

trans-unit.source: REG_SZ:
trans-unit.target: REG_SZ:

trans-unit.source: Value: The string values added in this registry key location can be either DNS domain name format (for example, adrms.contoso.com) or full URLs to trusted AD RMS servers (for example, https://adrms.contoso.com).
trans-unit.target: Value: The string values added in this registry key location can be either DNS domain name format (for example, adrms.contoso.com) or full URLs to trusted AD RMS servers (for example, https://adrms.contoso.com).

trans-unit.source: If a specified URL starts with https://, the RMS client will use SSL or TLS to contact the specified AD RMS server.
trans-unit.target: If a specified URL starts with https://, the RMS client will use SSL or TLS to contact the specified AD RMS server.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>RMS Service Discovery
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>RMS Service Discovery

trans-unit.source: RMS service discovery lets the RMS client check which RMS server or service to communicate with before protecting content.
trans-unit.target: RMS service discovery lets the RMS client check which RMS server or service to communicate with before protecting content.

trans-unit.source: Service discovery might also happen when the RMS client consumes protected content, but this is less likely to happen because the policy attached to the content contains the preferred RMS server or service and only if that is unsuccessful does the client then run service discovery.
trans-unit.target: Service discovery might also happen when the RMS client consumes protected content, but this is less likely to happen because the policy attached to the content contains the preferred RMS server or service and only if that is unsuccessful does the client then run service discovery.

trans-unit.source: Service discovery first looks for an on-premises version of Rights Management (AD RMS).
trans-unit.target: Service discovery first looks for an on-premises version of Rights Management (AD RMS).

trans-unit.source: If that is unsuccessful, service discovery automatically looks for the cloud version of Rights Management (Azure RMS).
trans-unit.target: If that is unsuccessful, service discovery automatically looks for the cloud version of Rights Management (Azure RMS).

trans-unit.source: To perform service discovery for an on-premises deployment, the RMS client checks the following:
trans-unit.target: To perform service discovery for an on-premises deployment, the RMS client checks the following:

trans-unit.source: The Windows registry on the local computer: If service discovery settings are configured in the registry, these settings are tried first.
trans-unit.target: The Windows registry on the local computer: If service discovery settings are configured in the registry, these settings are tried first.

trans-unit.source: By default, these settings are not configured in the registry.
trans-unit.target: By default, these settings are not configured in the registry.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory Domain Services: A domain-joined computer queries Active Directory for a service connection point (SCP).
trans-unit.target: Active Directory Domain Services: A domain-joined computer queries Active Directory for a service connection point (SCP).

trans-unit.source: If an SCP is registered, the URL of the RMS server is returned to the RMS client to use.
trans-unit.target: If an SCP is registered, the URL of the RMS server is returned to the RMS client to use.

trans-unit.source: AD RMS Only: Enabling Server-Side Service Discovery by Using Active Directory
trans-unit.target: AD RMS Only: Enabling Server-Side Service Discovery by Using Active Directory

trans-unit.source: If your account has sufficient privileges (Enterprise Admins and local administrator for the AD RMS server), you can automatically register a a service connection point (SCP) when you install the AD RMS root cluster server.
trans-unit.target: If your account has sufficient privileges (Enterprise Admins and local administrator for the AD RMS server), you can automatically register a a service connection point (SCP) when you install the AD RMS root cluster server.

trans-unit.source: If a SCP already exists in the forest, you must first delete the existing SCP before you can register a new one.
trans-unit.target: If a SCP already exists in the forest, you must first delete the existing SCP before you can register a new one.

trans-unit.source: You can register and delete an SCP after AD RMS is installed by using the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: You can register and delete an SCP after AD RMS is installed by using the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Before you start, make sure that your account has the required privileges (Enterprise Admins and local administrator for the AD RMS server).
trans-unit.target: Before you start, make sure that your account has the required privileges (Enterprise Admins and local administrator for the AD RMS server).

trans-unit.source: To enable AD RMS service discovery by registering an SCP in Active Directory
trans-unit.target: To enable AD RMS service discovery by registering an SCP in Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Open the Active Directory Management Services console at the AD RMS server:
trans-unit.target: Open the Active Directory Management Services console at the AD RMS server:

trans-unit.source: If you are using Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows Server 2008, click Start, click Administrative Tools, and then click Active Directory Rights Management Services.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Windows Server 2008 R2 or Windows Server 2008, click Start, click Administrative Tools, and then click Active Directory Rights Management Services.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012, in Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Active Directory Rights Management Services.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Windows Server 2012 R2 or Windows Server 2012, in Server Manager, click Tools, and then click Active Directory Rights Management Services.

trans-unit.source: In the AD RMS console right-click the AD RMS cluster, and then click Properties.
trans-unit.target: In the AD RMS console right-click the AD RMS cluster, and then click Properties.

trans-unit.source: Click the SCP tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SCP tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the Change SCP check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the Change SCP check box.

trans-unit.source: Select the Set SCP to current certification cluster option, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select the Set SCP to current certification cluster option, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Client-Side Service Discovery by Using the Windows Registry
trans-unit.target: Enabling Client-Side Service Discovery by Using the Windows Registry

trans-unit.source: As an alternative to using an SCP or where an SCP does not exist, you can configure the registry on the client computer so that the RMS client can locate its AD RMS server.
trans-unit.target: As an alternative to using an SCP or where an SCP does not exist, you can configure the registry on the client computer so that the RMS client can locate its AD RMS server.

trans-unit.source: To enable client-side AD RMS service discovery by using the Windows registry
trans-unit.target: To enable client-side AD RMS service discovery by using the Windows registry

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows registry editor, Regedit.exe:
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows registry editor, Regedit.exe:

trans-unit.source: On the client computer, in the Run window, type regedit, and then press ENTER to open the Registry Editor.
trans-unit.target: On the client computer, in the Run window, type regedit, and then press ENTER to open the Registry Editor.

trans-unit.source: In the Registry Editor, navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC.
trans-unit.target: In the Registry Editor, navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC.

trans-unit.source: If you are running a 32-bit application on a 64-bit computer, the path will be as follows:
trans-unit.target: If you are running a 32-bit application on a 64-bit computer, the path will be as follows:

trans-unit.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\MSIPC
trans-unit.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\MSIPC

trans-unit.source: To create the ServiceLocation subkey, right-click MSIPC, point to New, click Key, and then type ServiceLocation.
trans-unit.target: To create the ServiceLocation subkey, right-click MSIPC, point to New, click Key, and then type ServiceLocation.

trans-unit.source: To create the EnterpriseCertification subkey, right-click ServiceLocation, point to New, click Key, and then type EnterpriseCertification.
trans-unit.target: To create the EnterpriseCertification subkey, right-click ServiceLocation, point to New, click Key, and then type EnterpriseCertification.

trans-unit.source: To set the enterprise certification URL, double-click the (Default) value, under the EnterpriseCertification subkey, and when the Edit String dialog box appears, for Value data, type ://AD RMS_cluster_name/_wmcs/Certification, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: To set the enterprise certification URL, double-click the (Default) value, under the EnterpriseCertification subkey, and when the Edit String dialog box appears, for Value data, type ://AD RMS_cluster_name/_wmcs/Certification, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: To create the EnterprisePublishing subkey, right-click ServiceLocation, point to New, click Key, and then type EnterprisePublishing.
trans-unit.target: To create the EnterprisePublishing subkey, right-click ServiceLocation, point to New, click Key, and then type EnterprisePublishing.

trans-unit.source: To set the enterprise publishing URL, double-click (Default) , under the EnterprisePublishing subkey, and when the Edit String dialog box appears, type for Value data the following ://AD RMS_cluster_name/_wmcs/Licensing, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: To set the enterprise publishing URL, double-click (Default) , under the EnterprisePublishing subkey, and when the Edit String dialog box appears, type for Value data the following ://AD RMS_cluster_name/_wmcs/Licensing, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Close the Registry Editor.
trans-unit.target: Close the Registry Editor.

trans-unit.source: If the RMS client can't find an SCP by querying Active Directory and it's not specified in the registry, service discovery calls for AD RMS will fail.
trans-unit.target: If the RMS client can't find an SCP by querying Active Directory and it's not specified in the registry, service discovery calls for AD RMS will fail.

trans-unit.source: Redirecting Licensing Server Traffic
trans-unit.target: Redirecting Licensing Server Traffic

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you might need to redirect traffic during service discovery, for example, when two organizations are merged and the old licensing server in one organization is retired and clients need to be redirected to a new licensing server.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you might need to redirect traffic during service discovery, for example, when two organizations are merged and the old licensing server in one organization is retired and clients need to be redirected to a new licensing server.

trans-unit.source: Or, you migrate from AD RMS to Azure RMS.
trans-unit.target: Or, you migrate from AD RMS to Azure RMS.

trans-unit.source: To enable licensing redirection, use the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: To enable licensing redirection, use the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: To enable RMS licensing redirection by using the Windows registry
trans-unit.target: To enable RMS licensing redirection by using the Windows registry

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows registry editor, Regedit.exe:
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows registry editor, Regedit.exe:

trans-unit.source: On the client computer, in the Run window, type regedit, and then press ENTER to open the Registry Editor.
trans-unit.target: On the client computer, in the Run window, type regedit, and then press ENTER to open the Registry Editor.

trans-unit.source: In the Registry Editor, navigate to one of the following:
trans-unit.target: In the Registry Editor, navigate to one of the following:

trans-unit.source: For 64-bit version of Office on x64 platform: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\Servicelocation
trans-unit.target: For 64-bit version of Office on x64 platform: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\MSIPC\Servicelocation

trans-unit.source: For 32-bit version of Office on x64 platform: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\MSIPC\Servicelocation
trans-unit.target: For 32-bit version of Office on x64 platform: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\MSIPC\Servicelocation

trans-unit.source: Create a LicensingRedirection subkey, by right-clicking Servicelocation, point to New, click Key, and then type LicensingRedirection.
trans-unit.target: Create a LicensingRedirection subkey, by right-clicking Servicelocation, point to New, click Key, and then type LicensingRedirection.

trans-unit.source: To set the licensing redirection, right-click the LicensingRedirection subkey, select New, and then select String value.
trans-unit.target: To set the licensing redirection, right-click the LicensingRedirection subkey, select New, and then select String value.

trans-unit.source: For Name, specify the previous server licensing URL and for Value specify the new server licensing URL.
trans-unit.target: For Name, specify the previous server licensing URL and for Value specify the new server licensing URL.

trans-unit.source: For example, to redirect licensing from a server at Contoso.com to one at Fabrikam.com, you might enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: For example, to redirect licensing from a server at Contoso.com to one at Fabrikam.com, you might enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: Name:https://contoso.com/_wmcs/licensing
trans-unit.target: Name:https://contoso.com/_wmcs/licensing

trans-unit.source: Value:https://fabrikam.com/_wmcs/licensing
trans-unit.target: Value:https://fabrikam.com/_wmcs/licensing

trans-unit.source: If the old licensing server has both intranet and extranet URLs specified then a new name and value mapping has to be set for both of these URLs under the LicensingRedirection key.
trans-unit.target: If the old licensing server has both intranet and extranet URLs specified then a new name and value mapping has to be set for both of these URLs under the LicensingRedirection key.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step for all servers that need to be redirected.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step for all servers that need to be redirected.

trans-unit.source: Close the Registry Editor.
trans-unit.target: Close the Registry Editor.
